intro: Isoplexis chalcantha, commonly known as the silverleaf isoplexis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for xeriscaping. Its ornamental value and drought tolerance make it a popular plant in native gardens.
